snippet: As President Mohamed Morsi and his Muslim Brotherhood allies stood accused of authoritarianism, President Obama, via phone, urged him to offer his opposition compromises.
abstract: Pres Obama conducted phone call with Pres Mohamed Morsi during week of widespread protests in Egypt, urging him and his Muslim Brotherhood allies to offer compromises to opposition; Morsi has become besieged by increasingly violent demonstrations over his administration's turn toward authoritarianism.
lead_paragraph: As President Mohamed Morsi and his Muslim Brotherhood allies stood accused of authoritarianism, President Obama, via phone, urged him to offer his opposition compromises.

headline.main: Obama Walks a Fine Line With Egyptian President
headline.print_headline: Obama Walks a Fine Line With Egyptian President

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
